The requesters are the two main trade associations whose members are involved in the production and marketing of ROVs: the Recreational Off-Highway Vehicles Association (ROHVA) and the Outdoor Power Equipment Institute (OPEI). On behalf of its members, ROHVA requested a 60 day extension from the original due date for comments, February 2, 2015, to a later date, April 3, 2015. OPEI requested that the comment period be extended to August 30, 2015. &nbsp; Discussion: Although I have voted to support the staff's recommendation to extend the comment period for an additional 75 days, I do so with some reluctance. My misgiving stems from the basis upon which the requests have been made. Simply put, they rest mainly upon the declared need to further...</description>       <pubDate>Fri, 16 Jan 2015 12:41:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Statement on the Final Rule Buckballs.</description>       <pubDate>Wed, 14 May 2014 10:14:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Statement of Acting Chairman Robert S. Adler on the Notice of Proposed Rulemaking Regarding an Amendment to the Regulation on Information Disclosure Under Section 6(b) of the Consumer Product Safety</title>       <link>http://www.cpsc.gov/en/About-CPSC/Commissioners/Robert-Adler/Commissioner-Adler-Statements/Statement-of-Acting-Chairman-Robert-S-Adler-on-the-Notice-of-Proposed-Rulemaking-Regarding-an-Amendment-to-the-Regulation-on-Information-Disclosure/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=Adler+Statements</link>       <guid>http://www.cpsc.gov/en/About-CPSC/Commissioners/Robert-Adler/Commissioner-Adler-Statements/Statement-of-Acting-Chairman-Robert-S-Adler-on-the-Notice-of-Proposed-Rulemaking-Regarding-an-Amendment-to-the-Regulation-on-Information-Disclosure/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=Adler+Statements</guid>       <description>This week, the Commission voted to publish in the Federal Register a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPR) regarding an amendment to the CPSC\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds regulation (16 C.F.R. part 1101) of information disclosure under section 6(b) of the Consumer Product Safety Act (CPSA). &nbsp;I believe this proposed rule will modernize and streamline our regulation \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and, more importantly, better align it to comply with our statutory obligations to assure the accuracy and fairness of information the agency discloses to the public. &nbsp; I have never hidden my dislike for section 6(b) of the CPSA.&nbsp; I have long believed it inappropriately puts the agency in the role of a national data nanny of vital consumer product safety information.&nbsp; To cite only a few problems with this section: &nbsp; Section 6(b)\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds cumbersome procedures and unnecessary delays put consumers\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd lives and limbs at risk by requiring the CPSC to restrict the flow of critical safety information to the public. The Commission, unlike any of our sister agencies...</description>       <pubDate>Fri, 14 Feb 2014 09:45:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Joint Statement of Chairman Tenenbaum, Commissioner Adler and Commissioner Robinson on the Notice of Proposed Rulemaking Regarding Voluntary Recall Notices and Corrective Action Plans</title>       <link>http://www.cpsc.gov/en/About-CPSC/Commissioners/Robert-Adler/Commissioner-Adler-Statements/Joint-Statement-Voluntary-Recall-Notices-and-Corrective-Action-Plans/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=Adler+Statements</link>       <guid>http://www.cpsc.gov/en/About-CPSC/Commissioners/Robert-Adler/Commissioner-Adler-Statements/Joint-Statement-Voluntary-Recall-Notices-and-Corrective-Action-Plans/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=Adler+Statements</guid>       <description>The Chairman and Commissioners explaining their votes to publish the notice of proposed rulemaking regarding the voluntary recall notice and corrective action plans in the federal register. </description>       <pubDate>Fri, 15 Nov 2013 16:11:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Statement of the Honorable Robert S.
